message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.IR 

This paper proposes a system for automatic detection of idling cars using infrared imaging and deep networks. The paper relies on spatio-temporal modeling and event detection in IR image sequences, which suggests that it belongs to the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The use of deep networks for spatio-temporal modeling further supports the inclusion of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as a likely sub-category. The paper also involves tracking and classification of cars, which suggests that robotics (cs.RO) could be another relevant sub-category. Finally, the use of infrared imaging as a sensing modality suggests that the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR) could also be relevant.
